thread.title: Model and skateboarding friend rescue children who fell into icy lake in New York's Central Park | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Model and skateboarding friend rescue children who fell into icy lake in New York's Central Park | London Evening Standard

author: Hatty Collier
title: Model and skateboarding friend rescue children who fell into icy lake in New York's Central Park | London Evening Standard
text:
Wednesday 22 February 2017 11:59 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Dramatic rescue: Seven youths fell through the ice 
A model and his skateboarding friend saved seven children from drowning when they fell through a frozen lake in New York’s Central Park. 
The youths were messing about and taking selfies on the ice on Monday night when it fractured and they fell into the water. 
Ethan Turnbull, 24, and Bennett Jonas, 23, were skateboarding nearby and saw the ice collapse. 
The duo managed to drag them out using a ladder and tourists filmed the drama. Model Ethan Turnbull was one of the rescuers 
Writing on Instagram, Mr Turnbull said: “I had to make a decision to get in the middle of that or watch them drown. 
"When I got about waist deep two of the kids jumped on top of me and pulled me under. 
“I had to pick them both up and throw them to Ethan. I then grabbed a ladder and pulled the next two in. Mr Turnball was skateboarding nearby when the kids fell through the ice 
"Behind them were two lifeless bodies that I knew I couldn't get to. 
“I swam out and grabbed the last two guys and was able to get them to shore and keep them alive.” 
The teenagers were all pulled to safety and treated for hypothermia, with one taken to hospital. More about:
